thread.title: Lenovo Vibe P1 and Vibe P1m launched with Gigantic Battery
thread.title_full: Lenovo Vibe P1 and Vibe P1m launched with Gigantic Battery

title: Lenovo Vibe P1 and Vibe P1m launched with Gigantic Battery
text:
Lenovo Vibe P1 and Vibe P1m launched with Gigantic Battery 21st, Oct 2015 5:15 PM View: 7 0 
Lenovo Vibe smartphones are the portfolio devices to be added to the list. The company has just unveiled Lenovo Vibe P1 and Vibe P1m to feature high powered battery . The devices are priced at Rs. 15,999 and Rs. 7,999 respectively with an exclusive sale over Flipkart . The Vibe P1 will go on sale from Tuesday while Vibe P1m will be flashed out from Wednesday next week. The registration begins this Wednesday for the smartphones.Both the smartphones come with a dedicated hardware toggle on the left side, with which users can switch to a power saving mode. The devices run Android 5.1 Lollipop version but carry different screen size, processors, RAM and storage facility. Being the ‘Lite’ version, Vibe P1m surfaces smaller screen size. The battery suites that are provided with the handsets are 5000mAh for Vibe P1 and 4000mAh for Vibe P1m. The Lenovo Vibe P1 features 5.5-inch full-HD (1080x1920 pixels) IPS display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for protection. It is powered by Snapdragon 615 octa-core processor clocked at 1.5GHz, Adreno 405 GPU and coupled with 3GB of RAM. Under the hoods, it supports 16GB storage that is expandable via microSD card. It is ported with NFC and USB OTG ports. The dual-SIM supportive phone has 4G LTE band. Its snapper’s edge has 13-megapixel rear camera and 5-megapixel front camera. It also bears 24-watt charging capability that claims to charge the smartphone a bit faster.On the other hand, Lenovo Vibe P1m features 5-inch HD (720x1280 pixels) display. It grabs its power from 64-bit quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor that is coupled with 2GB RAM and paired with 16GB storage with expandability. Further stating, the company has also launched Lenovo A1000, A6000 and K3 Note music . The smartphones will be available via offline retail stores from the last week of October, priced at Rs. 4,999, Rs. 9,999 and Rs. 12,999 respectively.
